posts.post_content:
Great card. 6 power for 6 mana is fine, one black to regenerate it is great too, and making them lose 6 while the champion is in play is even better.  
Not to mention that when you play [False Cure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=False Cure) when the champ gets finally killed, they lose another 6.
posts.html:

Rating:

Everlasting Torment and Forsaken Wastes as mono-black-friendly variations on Leyline of Punishment and Sulfuric Vortex.

You could also target yourself and use Boon Reflection, Sanguine Bond, and Tainted Sigil...as if the latter two aren't dangerous enough already.

@Japicx: Rain of Gore would not work, since your opponent doesn't control Laquatus's Champion. Of course, you could use a Bazaar Trader to "fix" that "problem." If you also run Sulfuric Vortex, you can make sure they can't gain the life back by killing it before you Donate it. (The combo will still work because you get to choose which replacement effect to use.)

posts.post_content: The grammar is right, the apostrophe and s after a name that ends with s is used when you're refering to the name of a famous person or entity, in this case old [Ambassador Laquatus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ambassador Laquatus)

posts.post_content: I don't see a legendary super-type, so use him in conjunction with a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication). Outright kill one person at full health and bring another down to half. since this a late game trick, more likely than not the second person will be killed as well, or at least be dangerously low on life.

@mtear  
No, this is correct. It is one of those weird exceptions to the rules of English that make it such a pain in the ass to pick up as a second language.  
  
http://www.grammarbook.com/punctuation/apostro.asp (Rule 2)  
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apostrophe#Singular\_nouns\_ending\_with\_an\_.22s.22\_or\_.22z.22\_sound  
http://owl.english.purdue.edu/owl/resource/621/01/  
  
Just takes a bit of googling. -\_-
